nodes.bodyText:
You should use the Asciidoctor Macro to create links from MessageSource and ResourceBundleMessageSource to Javadocs.
e.g.
api:context.MessageSource[]
api:context.i18n.ResourceBundleMessageSource[].
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@
+Micronaut supports internationalization (i18n) by allowing it's applications to resolve text messages written in different languages and locales.  Messages are usually grouped by locale and 
+accessed through key/value pairs in properties files named for that language and locale.  These properties files are referred to as resource bundles.
+
+MessageSource is an interface for resolving messages from some defined source.  In Micronaut's context, i18n messages are retrieved from resource bundles using the class ResourceBundleMessageSource.

nodes.bodyText: This file should be named bundle.adoc. Moreover, this file is not included in toc.yml. Thus, if you run ./gradlew docs it is not included in the docs.

@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+== Internationalization (i18n)
+
+Micronaut provides for internationalization by reading user defined properties files.  A resource bundle is the grouping
+of all properties files with the same base name.  All locales translations will provide the keys the same but the values
+will be in the language specified.
+
+messages.properties - file will define key value pairs like this:
+
+[source,text]
+app.title=micronaut.demo
+
+To retrieve this message inside your application, you will use the ResourceBundle like this:
+
+[source,java]
+package com.example;
